medical_history.chief_complaint: Needle-like pain in the upper abdomen.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at least 15 days prior to November 18, 2020. It was transient, relieved shortly but occasionally serious, accompanied by vomiting. After initial treatment, persistent needle-like pain remained, with a recurrence of abdominal pain lasting for 2 weeks post-discharge. Enteroscopic examination indicated multiple ulcers in the distal jejunum.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a smoking history of 20 years (50 cigarettes per day) but had not smoked for 20 years. He also had a history of alcohol consumption (about 150 g per day) for 40 years.
